articles.description: During the first Cold War, American and British spies would sometimes place coded messages in newspaper classified ads to communicate with each other. And depending on how you interpret a new report in the New York Times, the National Security Agency (NSA) ha…
articles.title: NSA Sent Coded Messages From Its Official Twitter Account to Communicate With Foreign Spies
articles.author: Matt Novak

articles.description: He is the second Trump administration aide to resign this week after being accused of physical and emotional abuse toward a former wife.
articles.title: White House Speechwriter Resigns Amid Abuse Accusations
articles.author: KATIE ROGERS

articles.description: President Trump has stayed largely on the sidelines as a volatile stock market plunged, lawmakers sealed a budget deal, and a top aide was ousted over abuse claims.
articles.title: News Analysis: Amid Turmoil From Washington to Wall Street, a Surprisingly Passive President
articles.author: PETER BAKER

articles.description: President Trump said a memo drafted by Democrats on the House Intelligence Committee was “very political and long” and would have to be heavily redacted to protect “sources and methods (and more).”
articles.title: Trump Says Democrats’ Rebuttal Memo Was a Setup
articles.author: MARK LANDLER

articles.description: The president dismissed an idea circulated by some aides and allies that he’d been unhappy with Ms. Hope’s role in workshopping an initial forceful defense of Mr. Porter.
articles.title: As Other Aides Face Trump’s Ire Over Rob Porter’s Departure, Hope Hicks Is Praised
articles.author: KATIE ROGERS

articles.description: After months of secret negotiations, the Russian tried to include the information as part of a deal that would let the United States buy its stolen cyberweapons.
articles.title: American Spies Paid $100,000 to Russian Who Wanted to Sell Material on Trump
articles.author: MATTHEW ROSENBERG

articles.description: Army soldiers carry the casket of Staff Sgt. Dustin Wright of Lyons, Ga., who was killed by extremists in an Oct. 4 ambush in Niger. A Pentagon investigation has recommended scaling back West Africa missions like the one that killed Sergeant Wright and three …
articles.title: Inquiry of Soldiers’ Deaths Urges Curtailing West Africa Missions
articles.author: THOMAS GIBBONS-NEFF, HELENE COOPER and ERIC SCHMITT

articles.description: The 2018 Pyeongchang Games are officially underway and now it's a race to see which country scores the most golds and overall medals in the next two weeks. On Saturday, The Netherlands pulled off a medals sweep in the women's 3,000-meter speed skating event, …
articles.title: The Netherlands celebrated their Winter Olympics win by trolling Trump
articles.author: Raymond Wong

articles.description: While the Olympics games kicked off, the stock market sinks, and a day after a government shutdown, President Trump tweeted in defense of an accused serial abuser. The story of now-former aide Rob Porter has dominated much of the news cycle this week. After p…
articles.title: Trump's tweet defending Rob Porter sets off a fiery backlash
articles.author: Peter Allen Clark

articles.description: Every two years, for a few weeks, we all get to enjoy a global phenomenon that brings many countries together: Leslie Jones live-tweeting the Olympics. Since the Opening Ceremony kicked off the Winter Games yesterday, the Saturday Night Live comedian has retu…
articles.title: The Leslie Jones Winter Olympics live-tweeting has officially begun!
articles.author: Peter Allen Clark

articles.description: Three years ago, the National Park Service banned trucks and buses heavier than 10 tons from crossing over the Arlington Memorial Bridge, a major transportation artery connecting Virginia to Washington D.C. And there's speculation that the U.S. Secret Service…
articles.title: Crumbling national parks mired in $11 billion backlog, but experts scoff at jacking up fees
articles.author: Mark Kaufman

articles.description: Tax cuts and economic growth appear to be improving the party’s political position, but President Trump can’t seem to stop antagonizing voters, especially women.
articles.title: News Analysis: Republicans Have an Election Message, but Trump’s Insensitive Remarks Undercut It
articles.author: JONATHAN MARTIN and ALEXANDER BURNS

articles.description: President Trump blocked the release of a classified Democratic memo, setting up a potential showdown with Congress over the fate of its contents.
articles.title: Trump Blocks Release of Memo Rebutting Republican Claims
articles.author: NICHOLAS FANDOS

articles.description: A tribunal official fired without explanation last week had been in talks that could have ended in plea deals and foreclosed any possibility of execution.
articles.title: Fired Official Was Exploring Resolution to 9/11 Case Precluding Death Penalty
articles.author: CHARLIE SAVAGE

articles.description: Prime Minister Viktor Orban has remade the country’s political system and pioneered a model of one-party rule. His actions can be seen as part of a broader decline of democracy.
articles.title: As West Fears the Rise of Autocrats, Hungary Shows What’s Possible
articles.author: PATRICK KINGSLEY

articles.title: Where should the IS 'Beatles' be tried?

articles.description: CNN's chief legal analyst Jeffrey Toobin derides President Trump's decision to block the release of the Democratic rebuttal to the Republican intelligence memo alleging FBI abuses of its surveillance authority
articles.title: Toobin: Trump censoring Democrats' argument

articles.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper says President Trump is remarkably forgiving when it comes to certain alleged abusers.
articles.title: Cooper: Trump forgiving alleged abusers

articles.description: After the resignation of Rob Porter, President Trump tweets that lives are being shattered and destroyed by a mere allegation, adding some are true and some are false.
articles.title: Trump: Lives shattered by mere allegation

articles.description: Meghan McCain told CNN's Van Jones that she's no fan of President Donald Trump but she sees "a lot of gray zone" when it comes to his supporters and argues their views should not be dismissed.
articles.title: Meghan McCain sees 'a lot of gray' with Trump voters
articles.author: Alexandra King, CNN
